io.atomix.resource

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.resource.Resource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DistributedLeaderElection, DistributedLock, DistributedMap, DistributedMembershipGroup, DistributedMessageBus, DistributedMultiMap, DistributedQueue, DistributedSet, DistributedTopic, DistributedValue

    public abstract class Resource
extends Object
    Fault-tolerant stateful distributed object.

    Resources are stateful distributed objects that run across a set of RaftServers in a cluster.

    Resources can be created either as standalone StateMachines in a typical Copycat cluster or as Atomix resources. Operations on the resource are translated into Commands and Querys which are submitted to the cluster where they're logged and replicated.

    Resources have varying consistency guarantees depending on the configured resource Consistency and the semantics of the specific resource implementation.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • context

        public ThreadContext context()
        Returns the resource thread context.
        Returns:
        The resource thread context.

      • with

        public Resource with(Consistency consistency)
        Sets the resource consistency level.

        The configured consistency level specifies how operations on the resource should be handled by the cluster. Consistency levels dictate the order in which reads, writes, and events should be handled by the Atomix cluster and the consistency requirements for completing different types of operations.

        Note that consistency configurations apply only to a single instance of a distributed resource. Two instances of the same resource on the same or different nodes can have differen consistency requirements, and the cluster will obey those differences.

        By default, all resource operations are submitted to the cluster with the Consistency.ATOMIC consistency level. Atomic consistency means that the distributed resource will behave as a single object for all instances. Users can decrease the default consistency level, but note that in some cases resource implementations may override the configured Consistency for safety. For instance, a leader election may enforce atomic consistency at all times to ensure no two leaders can be elected at the same time.

        Parameters:
        consistency - The resource consistency level.
        Returns:
        The resource instance.

      • delete

        public CompletableFuture<Void> delete()
        Deletes the resource state.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the resource has been deleted.
